meanings.definition: A person or thing that inculcates beliefs or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a great inculcators of knowledge, always inspiring his students to learn.
meanings.sent2: The inculcators at the museum guided visitors through the history of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The inculcators at the zoo convinced the monkeys to try a new dance routine.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite book became the inculcators of her passion for adventure.
meanings.sent5: The inculcators of kindness spread joy wherever they went.

meanings.sent1: The inculcators in the library helped students find the right books.
meanings.sent2: The group of inculcators gathered to discuss their teaching methods.
meanings.sent3: The inculcators in the garden whispered secrets to the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The inculcators of change brought new ideas to the community.
meanings.sent5: The inculcators of tradition upheld the values of their ancestors.
